704788f-a.text:
Hanson Place, at the N.E. corner of Ashland Place, showing the towered structure of the Williamsburg Bank. The small buildings to the left of same (east side of Ashland Place) are the Salvation Army Quarters. Continuing to the left (north of the latter) is the Academy of Music Building. The vacant lot shown at the N.W. corner of Hanson Place and St. Felix Street was the site of the former Hanson Place M.E. Church. On the extreme lower right appears the low structure of the Long Island Rail-road Station, one side of which is on Flatbush Ave., which has the Fifth Ave. Elevated Line thereon. In the background, intersecting Lafayette
Ave., is Fulton Street and its Elevated Line.
About 1929.
Ewing Galloway.
704788f-a.folder: Hanson Place & Ashland Place, Brooklyn, NY

704787f-a.text:

View 2 is from Nevins and State Streets.
View 1: May 17, 1940
View 2: June 15, 1940
P. L. Sperr

704785f-b.text:
1 Hanson Place, at the N. E. corner of Ashland Place, showing the 26-story Willlamsburg Savings Bank Building occupying that site. The view is across excavation work on Dean Street, near Third Avenue.
Views 2 and 3 are across a clearance between Livingston and Schermerhorn Streets, extending to Flatbush Avenue ("El"
thereon). On the right is the Baptist Temple.
View 1: January 26, 1930
View 2: February 14, 1931
View 3: April 20, 1931
P. L. Sperr
704785f-b.folder: Hanson Place & Ashland Place, Brooklyn, NY
